Why the hell would you have "Fall head over heels/simp for" in any translation? "Simp" is new-age memespeak, so it's pretty obvious that "head over heels for" is accurate. A slash (/) is used to denote equivalent terminology for interpretation, but this clearly isn't equivalent terminology.
So many translations are pointlessly saddled with meme slang that hinders immersion.
